entry.title: Collective Search Help Using Abstract Entity in RAP
entry.content:
Collective Value Help with Abstract Entity in SAP RAP, you can define a Collective Search Help that combines multiple elementary search helps. This allows users to choose between different search paths and fetch values from various sources in a single dialog. The same concept is available in SAP Fiori through a Collective Value Help. It is implemented using an Abstract Entity that aggregates multiple elementary value helps and defines potential field mappings.

An Abstract Entity does not hold data. Instead, it acts as a container for the Collective Search Help. This means it only groups together multiple elementary value helps and defines how they are mapped, without storing any business data itself.

  • The Collective Value Help shall be annotated with @ObjectModel.collectiveValueHelp.for.element pointing to the field for which the collective value help is defined.
  • The referenced field must be assigned at least one elementary value help using the annotation @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition.
  •  This setup ensures that your Collective Value Help aggregates multiple search options seamlessly for end-users.

Only specific keywords are allowed in a collective value help:

  •  Entity.name
  •  Entity. Element
  • additional Binding local Element
  • additional Binding. Element qualifier
  • Qualifier

Create a Abstract Entity

@EndUserText.label: 'Abstract entity'
@ObjectModel.supportedCapabilities: [ #COLLECTIVE_VALUE_HELP ]
@ObjectModel.collectiveValueHelp.for.element: 'Country'
define abstract entity ZSM_ABSTRACT_CDS_ENTITY

{
  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [
  {
       entity: { name: 'I_Country' },
       label: 'Search by Country'
  },
   {
      entity: {
      name: 'I_RegionVH',
      element: 'Country'
  },
  additionalBinding: [{ localElement: 'Region', element: 'Region' }],
  label   : 'Search by Region',
  qualifier: 'Regionsearch'
   }
   ]
  Country : land1;
  Region  : regio;
}

@ObjectModel.CollectiveValueHelp.for.element → 

  •  Specifies the field (Country) for which the collective value help is defined.
  •  The Abstract Entity (zsm_abstract_cds_entity)  acts as a container, not holding data itself. acts as a Consumption value Help Definition search paths Defines multiple Search by Country (default value help) (alternative path with additional Search by Region binding to Region.

@Consumption.valueHelpDefintion → Defines multiple search paths :

  • Search by Country( default Value Help )
  • Search by Region( Alternate path with additional binding to Region )

Create an Interface View on Database Table.

Assign a Value Help for the Country field inside a Metadata Extension CDS.

Here Country field uses Collective search help( ZSM_I_TRAVEL) with binding to Region.

Behavior Definition for the above Interface View.

Projection View for the Above Interface view.

Behavior Definition for the Interface View.

Service Binding ( OData – V4 ) to expose the Entity ( ZSM_C_TRAVEL ) to the front end.

F4 for Country Field – Search by Country, Search by region two value help screen.

entry.title: SAP Integration Suite - Content Modifier
entry.content:
Content Modifier

Content Modifier is a tool used in integration processes to adjust incoming messages by modifying headers, properties, or the message body to meet specific requirements.

Content Modifier has 4 types:

  1. General.
  2. Message Header.
  3. Exchange Property.
  4. Message Body.

General:

In General We can change the Content Modifier Name as you want.

 

Message Header:

These carry metadata about the message, such as content type or routing information.

Note: Metadata refers to information about the message itself, not the content of the message.

 

Exchange Property:

Exchange Property is a key/value pair used to store data temporarily during message processing. It's a powerful and flexible way to pass information between steps in an integration flow. 

 

Message Body:

In message body there are:

  1. Type – In type there are two types Constant - for fixed body & Expression - for Custom/Expression Language body.
  2. Body – We can call the headers & Properties which were created in the before fields and we can enter the custom body.

 

In Content Modifier, we can define values with source types according to requirement:

Constant:

  • To set a fixed value, Best for static data that doesn't change.
  • Example: Country = India

Expression:

  • Dynamic values, Allows you to use simple Expression Language.
  • Syntax: ${header.<name>}, ${property.<name>}

Global Variable:

  • Refers to values defined as Global Variables in the CPI runtime.
  • Used in more complex scenarios and reusable scripts.
  • When you define global settings used across many flows.

Header:

  • Gets the value from an existing message header.
  • Example: You may copy a header like Authorization into a new one.
  • When values are already present in headers and you want to reuse or forward them.

Local Variable:

  • Used for values created temporarily during the flow (like in scripts).
  • Best for temporary or calculated values.

Number Range:

  • Auto-generates a number from a configured number range.
  • Can be used to generate sequential IDs.

Property:

  • Gets the value from a message property (set in Content Modifier or other steps).
  • Example: Set city as a property earlier, then reuse it here.
  • Properties are used for temporary storage during flow execution.

XPath: Extracts data from the XML message body using an XPath expression.

  • Example: /root/customer/city

 

 

Content Modifier Example:

  • In Message Header - City Name added with value of Guntur with Constant type.

  • In Exchange Property – timestamp as Name with Expression Source type & Source Value is ${date:now:yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss}

  • In Message body we called the names added in Header & Property.

Output:

Time & Address are printed in the output body as shown in above image.

 

 

SAP Integration Suite  #Content Modifier #Message Header #Exchange Property

entry.title: Re: Is there a way to retrieve the maximum value within a...
Re: Is there a way to retrieve the maximum value within a...
Re: Error during copy of partner: Partner role SH
entry.content:
Hello @AngelT 

Thank you for your follow up and the screenshots,they have been so helpful

Thanks for the screenshots; they have been helpful. Here is what I can see and what is probably still missing.

What appears satisfactory

  • The assignment between Plant 05DB and Sales Org 10DB exists (CBC screen).
  • The shipping point determination for 05DB suggests 51PB looks good.
  • The BP 10401040 functions as both Supplier FLVN01 and Customer FLCU01 – Company Code, and supplier/customer cross-links are established is good.

What’s probably missing ,the usual obstacle

You have shown FLCU01 Customer – Company Code, but 4SD/SD partner determination uses FLCU00 Customer – Sales Area. Without Sales Area data, the Partner Functions tab doesn’t exist, and SH Ship-To cannot be determined.

What you should quickly check

Open BP 10401040 → Role FLCU00 Customer (Sales Area)

Add Sales Area = 10DB / your Distribution Channel/Division must match the plant’s sales organisation assignment.

Navigate to Partner Functions and ensure you have at least:

  • SP Sold-To= This BP
  • SH Ship-To = This BP or a different Ship-To BP if you use an alternative delivery address.
  • Optional BP Bill-To, PY Payer

If Ship-To uses a different address

Either create a dedicated Ship-To Business Partner with that address and assign it as SH in FLCU00 or keep one BP and use its standard address for deliveries. If you need an alternative delivery address for each order, handle it in the sales document.

Sanity Check

  • Please create a quick sales order in Sales Org 10DB for customer 10401040.
  • Review the Partners tab → SH needs to be suggested.
  • If SH is still missing, the partner determination procedure/assignment. The customer account group in Sales Org 10DB requires review.

Why Your Setup Still Fails

A second address on the BP or simply the FLCU01 view does not create the SH partner.

  • Only FLCU00 (Sales Area) and Partner Functions generate the SD SH role that the system looks for.

Let me know if it works

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Value Help in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition always resets and shows all entries
entry.content:
Hi all,

We are using S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

As shown in the attached screenshot, whenever I open a value help (for example, on customer or vendor fields), the dialog always resets and displays the full list of entries.

This is problematic in customer demos because we do not want to expose test or irrelevant master data.
Ideally, I would like to:
- Keep the last-used filter criteria when reopening the value help, or
- Apply a predefined default filter (e.g., Country = JP) automatically when opening the dialog.

So far I have tried:
- Personal Value List → lets me mark favorite values, but does not preserve filter conditions
- “Default Values” in Fiori Settings → works for global fields like company code, but not inside value help filters
- Variants → not available in certain apps (e.g., Invoice Summarization / Periodic Billing)

**My questions:**
1. Is there any standard way in Public Cloud to persist or predefine filter criteria in the value help dialog?
2. If not, should I understand this behavior as a system limitation by design?
3. How do other companies typically handle this in demos or daily operations when the value help contains many entries?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Driving AI Adoption with BTP: Highlights
entry.content:
A couple of days ago,  AI experts and SAP customers gathered at SAP AI Adoption Event in Barcelona to explore how Artificial Intelligence is reshaping business.

There we innovate with a fresh format designed to maximize both learning and practical engagement. The morning featured plenary sessions, where SAP leaders and experts shared the latest insights on how AI is transforming business. In the afternoon, participants had the opportunity to go deeper—joining hands-on workshops and 1:1 discussions with dedicated SAP experts to explore solutions tailored to their unique challenges.

The mix of high-level perspectives and practical deep dives created an environment where strategy met execution, ensuring that every attendee left not just inspired, but equipped with actionable next steps.

Why AI Now - and Why SAP?

AI is no longer experimental—it’s driving real business outcomes. Organizations need AI to boost efficiency, turn data into actionable insights, and respond proactively to changing business conditions. SAP’s Business AI helps companies act faster and smarter across every function.

SAP stands out because AI is embedded in core business processes, powered by trusted, unified data, and designed for scalability and customization. This ensures reliable insights, faster decisions, and measurable impact at enterprise scale.

Why it matters?

AI adoption today determines competitive advantage. Companies that leverage AI effectively can accelerate growth, improve customer experiences, optimize operations, and achieve sustainability goals—while those that wait risk falling behind.

 

Agenda Highlights & Session recap

Welcome & Introduction

Speaker: Marc Nolla

  • Set the stage with SAP’s strategic push on Artificial Intelligence
  • Challenge: What AI competitive advantage are you going to Build?

Link to presentation

Exploring the Potential of SAP BTP AI 

Speaker: Daniil Bolobonov & Marco Holzwarth

  • Explanation of our enterprise AI offering that integrates easily with your SAP systems (and also non-SAP!) to help you work smarter.
  • Architecture perspective of Joule extensibility and AI Foundation 

Link to presentation

AI Best Practices with SAP

Speaker: Alex Dalentzas

  • AI Evolution since 2016
  • Some learnings on how you can apply AI to your business processes
  • Autonomous ERP: a real case scenario
  • The relevance on an AI Architect

Link to presentation

SAP AI Portfolio and What's New

Speaker: Arthur Liebhardt

  • Sneak peek on the lastest innovations on Joule 
  • Joule Agents as the next era of business automation
  • Live demo of Generative AI Hub and Vibe Coding

Link to presentation

Hands-On Workshops

  • Four breakout room SAP BTP AI topics: 
    • Retrieval-Augmented Generation with SAP HANA Cloud
    • Automated Business Document proccessing with SAP Document AI
    • From Automation to Intelligent Business Conversations with Joule Studio
    • AI capabilities in Data and Analytics
  • Interaction with many customers and discussion on particular use cases
  • Opportunity to gain the digital badges for the hands-on
  • The portal for hands-on will be open until 2nd October 2025 for you to finish the exercises

For inquiries, please reach out to SAP BTP Adoption Workshop team: sap_btp_adoption_workshop@sap.com 

Closing Notes / Adoption and Next Steps

 Speaker: Ana Lopera

  • How to engage with your BTP CSM and move forward
  • SAP initiatives to support the AI and how can we help you to achieve it

Key Takeaways

  1. AI is delivering real business value today 
  2. Trusted, business-ready AI is essential
  3. SAP’s differentiator is integration at scale 
  4. Collaboration accelerates innovation 
  5. Act now or risk falling behind 

What’s Next?

Here’s how to keep the momentum going:

  • 💬 Contact your SAP BTP Customer Success Manager
  • 🎓 Visit SAP Discovery Center Missions on BTP

entry.title: Alternative Account Change Blocked in S/4HANA Cloud Public - French Legal Requirement
entry.content:
System: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Finance
Component: FI-FIO-GL-MD (G/L Master Data)
Country: France

Business Context

Due to recent changes in French accounting law, we need to urgently modify alternative account assignments for several G/L accounts in our French Chart of Accounts. This is a mandatory legal requirement for fiscal year 2025.

Technical Issue

When attempting to change alternative accounts for Fixed Asset-related G/L accounts (e.g., accounts in class 675 - Net book value of disposed assets, class 775 - Proceeds from asset disposals) under our French company codes, we receive the error:

"Changes not possible since account balance is not zero"

Current situation:

  • 2025 balances: Zero ✓
  • 2024 balances: Non-zero (causing the block)
  • 2023 balances: Unknown

Business Constraint

We cannot clear the 2024 balances because:

  • The fiscal year 2024 audit is completed and closed
  • Any modification to historical balances would violate audit compliance
  • These are Fixed Asset accounts (CORE accounts) with automatic postings from asset transactions

What We've Tried

  1. Opened SAP incident 
  2. SAP Support confirmed this is standard system behavior - requires zero balance for the last 2 fiscal years
  3. SAP suggested creating new G/L accounts as a workaround
  4. Business team escalated as this doesn't meet the legal requirement

Our Question

Has anyone faced a similar situation where legal/regulatory changes require alternative account modifications on Fixed Asset accounts with historical balances?

Specifically looking for:

  • Any SAP notes addressing this scenario
  • Possible exemption procedures for legal requirements
  • Alternative solutions that maintain audit compliance
  • Experience with similar French accounting law changes

This is blocking our legal compliance for 2025. Any insights would be greatly appreciated.

Tags: #S4HANA-Cloud ##GL-Master-Data #French-Accounting #Legal-Compliance #Alternative-Account #Fixed-Asset

entry.title: Advanced Intercompany Sales in SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
Advanced Intercompany Sales in SAP S/4HANA

Version: 1.0

 

1. Introduction to Advanced Intercompany Sales

 

1.1 What is the Purpose?

In a global business environment, it's common for one part of a company to sell a product to an external customer, while another affiliated company, perhaps in a different country, is responsible for manufacturing and/or delivering it. The Advanced Intercompany Sales process is designed to manage these complex, cross-company transactions seamlessly and efficiently.

A key feature of this process is the creation of an additional purchase order in the selling company and a corresponding sales order in the delivering company, automating the internal procurement and sales activities. This process uses

Valuated Stock in Transit (VSIT), which is crucial for maintaining clear financial visibility and control of inventory as it moves between affiliated companies and ultimately to the customer.

1.2 Key Benefits and Capabilities

The Advanced Intercompany Sales process in S/4HANA provides significant advantages:

  • Enhanced Profitability Reporting: It allows for accurate profitability analysis for both the selling and delivering affiliated companies.
  • Seamless Transfer of Control: Manages the clear and precise transfer of inventory ownership between the affiliates and the final customer.
  • Event-Based Revenue Recognition: Enables revenue to be recognized at the correct time based on specific events in the sales cycle, ensuring compliance and accurate financial statements.
  • Detailed Costing: Integrates with the material ledger and provides a cost component split, offering deep insight into product costs.
  • Integrated Compliance: Incorporates product and trade compliance checks directly into the process flow.
  • Transportation Management: Allows for full integration into transportation management processes, including the calculation and allocation of freight costs.

2. The Business Case Scenario

To understand the process in a practical context, this guide will follow a specific, real-world business scenario based on the pre-configured data in the SAP S/4HANA Fully-Activated Appliance.

  • The Seller: Sales Organization 1010, located in Germany. This is the entity that has the relationship with the end customer. They belong to
    Selling Company 1010.
  • The Customer: Customer 10100002, a domestic customer also located in Germany.
  • The Supplier/Deliverer: Plant 1710, located in the United States. This plant holds the stock and will ship the goods. It is owned by the
    Delivering Company 1710.
  • The Product: Material TG12, which is a trading good.

The Process Flow at a Glance

  1. The German Sales Organization (1010) receives a purchase order from the German customer (10100002).
  2. A sales order is created in the German company code (1010). However, the delivering plant is specified as the US plant (1710).
  3. The system automatically triggers the creation of an intercompany purchase order in the German company (1010) and an intercompany sales order in the US company (1710).
  4. The US plant (1710) ships the goods directly to the German customer.
  5. The goods are temporarily held in Valuated Stock in Transit (VSIT), which is owned by the selling company (1010) but managed within their plant (1010).
  6. The US company (1710) sends an intercompany invoice to the German company (1010) for the goods.
  7. The German company (1010) sends the final customer invoice to the German customer (10100002).

This structure ensures that both legal entities (US and German companies) have the correct accounting and logistical documents to reflect the transaction accurately.

3. Prerequisites and Initial Setup

Before executing the test plan, it's essential to ensure the system is properly set up. This section covers the required system access, user roles, master data, and other necessary configurations.

3.1 System Access and User Roles

  • System: This guide is designed for an SAP S/4HANA 2023 Fully-Activated Appliance. Access is typically via the SAP Fiori launchpad.
  • Demo User: You can use the standard demo user provided with the appliance:
    • User: S4H_SD_DEM
    • Password: Welcome1
  • Business Roles: The end-to-end process involves several business roles. The
    S4H_SD_DEM user is pre-assigned the necessary roles, which include:
    • Internal Sales Representative
    • Shipping Specialist
    • Billing Clerk
    • Accounts Payable Accountant
    • Inventory Manager

3.2 Master and Organizational Data

The following master and organizational data are pre-configured in the appliance and will be used throughout the exercises. Using your own data is possible, but this sample data is recommended for following the guide.

Key Master Data

Data Type

Value

Details and Role in the Process

Material

TG12

The trading good being sold to the customer.

Customer

10100002

The end customer in Germany who buys the product.

Intercompany Payer

10401010

From the US Delivering Company's perspective, this represents the German Selling Company as a customer. It's the payer in the intercompany invoice.

Intercompany Supplier

17401710

From the German Selling Company's perspective, this represents the US Delivering Company as a vendor. It's the invoicing party for the intercompany supplier invoice.

Intercompany Plant Customer

10411010

From the US Delivering Company's perspective, this represents the German plant (1010) as a customer (the sold-to party) in the intercompany sales order.

Intercompany Plant Supplier

BP1710

From the German Selling Company's perspective, this represents the US plant (1710) as a vendor in the automatically created purchase order.

Export to Sheets

Key Organizational Data

Data Type

Value

Details

Selling Co.'s Sales Org

1010

The sales organization in the German selling company.

Delivering Co.'s Sales Org

1710

The sales organization in the US delivering company.

Distribution Channel

10

Direct Sales channel.

Division

00

General product division.

Export to Sheets

3.3 How to Create New Master Data

While this guide uses pre-existing data, in a real project, you would need to create it. For detailed instructions on creating master data objects, refer to the

SAP Best Practices for SAP S/4HANA Master Data Scripts (MDS).

Master Data ID

Description

BND

Create Customer Master

BNE

Create Supplier Master

BNF

Create Product Master of Type "Trading Good"

Export to Sheets

3.4 System Preparation

Before you begin, ensure the following preparatory steps are completed:

  1. Open MM Posting Periods: The material management posting periods must be open for the current month in both company codes (1010 and 1710). This is a standard periodic task required for any goods movement. This is detailed in the post-deployment steps for the appliance.
  2. (Optional) Procure Material TG12: If you run out of stock for material TG12 in the delivering plant (1710), you can add more using the Manage Stock (F1062) Fiori app or transaction MIGO.
  3. (Optional) Create Condition Records: If pricing has been customized, you may need to create sales pricing condition records to ensure prices are determined correctly in the sales and billing documents. This is done using the procedures in the "Create Sales Pricing Condition" Master Data Script.

4. Consultant's Corner: Customizing Insights

This guide is based on a pre-configured, fully-activated appliance where all necessary customizing is already complete. However, for consultants implementing this solution, understanding the configuration backbone is critical. Below are the conceptual areas in SPRO (or via CBC for cloud) that underpin the Advanced Intercompany Sales process.

  • Enterprise Structure (Assignment): The fundamental assignments must be in place.
    • Assign Plant (1710) to Company Code (1710).
    • Assign Sales Organization (1010, 1710) to Company Code (1010, 1710).
    • Set up the sales areas (Sales Org / Dist. Channel / Division).
  • Sales and Distribution:
    • Sales Document Type: The customer sales order type (OR in this demo) needs to be configured to allow this process. Key settings are often in the item category determination.
    • Item Category: The item category determined for material TG12 in the sales order is crucial. It must be configured to trigger the creation of an intercompany purchase requisition and subsequent purchase order.
    • Partner Determination: Procedures must be set up to correctly determine the intercompany partners (e.g., the intercompany supplier and customer) in the sales and purchasing documents.
    • Billing: The intercompany billing type (IV2) and the customer billing type (F2) must be configured with the correct settings for pricing, account determination, and posting rules.
  • Materials Management:
    • Purchase Order Document Type: A specific document type for the automatic intercompany PO is required.
    • Valuated Stock in Transit: Configuration for VSIT is essential. This involves setting up the stock-in-transit valuation and the specific movement types that post goods into and out of SIT.
  • Financial Accounting:
    • Automatic Account Determination (OBYC/VKOA): This is critical for ensuring all goods movements and billing documents post to the correct G/L accounts automatically. This includes accounts for revenue, cost of goods sold, receivables, payables, and inventory.

Executing this process successfully relies on the tight integration and correct configuration of these SD, MM, and FI components.

5. End-to-End Process Walkthrough & Test Plan

This section provides a detailed, step-by-step guide to execute the Advanced Intercompany Sales process. It is structured as a practical, hands-on test plan that you can follow in your system.

Overall Process Flow Overview

Step #

Process Step

Business Role

Fiori App / Transaction

1

Create Sales Order

Internal Sales Rep

Manage Sales Orders (F1873)

2

Display Intercompany PO

Internal Sales Rep

Monitor Value Chains (F4854)

3

Display Intercompany SO

Internal Sales Rep

Monitor Value Chains (F4854)

4

Create Delivery

Shipping Specialist

Create Outbound Deliveries (F0869A)

5

Perform Picking

Shipping Specialist

Manage Outbound Deliveries (F0867A)

6

Post Goods Issue

Shipping Specialist

Manage Outbound Deliveries (F0867A)

7

Confirm Transfer of Control

Shipping Specialist

Manage Outbound Deliveries (F0867A)

8

Create Intercompany Invoice

Billing Clerk

Create Billing Documents (F0798)

9

Display Intercompany Supplier Invoice

Accounts Payable Accountant

Supplier Invoices List (F1060a)

10

Create Customer Invoice

Billing Clerk

Create Billing Documents (F0798)

11

Monitor Value Chain

Internal Sales Rep

Monitor Value Chains (F4854)

Export to Sheets

Test Case 1: Execute the Advanced Intercompany Sales Flow

Objective: To create a customer sales order in the selling company that is delivered by an affiliated company, and to process all subsequent logistical and financial documents correctly.

Step 1: Create Sales Order (Selling Company)

Objective: The process starts when the selling company creates a sales order for the external customer, but specifies that the goods will be delivered from an affiliate's plant.

  • Role: Internal Sales Representative
  • App: Manage Sales Orders (F1873)

Execution Steps:

  1. Log on to the Fiori launchpad as user
    S4H_SD_DEM.
  2. Navigate to the
    Sales section and open the Manage Sales Orders app.
  3. Click
    Create Sales Order.
  4. Enter the following organizational data and press Enter :
    • Order Type: OR
    • Sales Organization: 1010
    • Distribution Channel: 10
    • Division: 00
  5. On the
    Create Standard Order: Overview screen, enter the following header and item data :
    • Sold-to Party: 10100002
    • Cust. Reference: PO-INTERCOMPANY-TEST
    • Deliver. Plant: 1710 (This is the critical step: specifying the US affiliate plant).
    • Material: TG12
    • Order Quantity: 10
  6. Go to the item details by selecting the item and navigating to the
    Shipping tab.
  7. Fill in the following field:
    • Transit Plant: 1010. This plant represents the selling company's ownership of the stock while it is in transit.
  8. Click
    Save.

Expected Result: A standard sales order is created in the selling company (1010). Note down the Sales Order Number. The system automatically triggers the creation of an intercompany purchase order in company 1010 and an intercompany sales order in company 1710 in the background.

Step 2: Display Intercompany Purchase Order

Objective: To confirm that the system automatically created an intercompany purchase order in the selling company to procure the goods from the delivering company.

  • Role: Internal Sales Representative
  • App: Monitor Value Chains (F4854)

Execution Steps:

  1. From the Fiori launchpad, open the
    Monitor Value Chains app.
  2. In the filter bar, enter the following:
    • Initiating Document: Your Sales Order number from Step 1.
    • Process Type: Advanced Intercompany Sales
  3. Click Go.
  4. Click on the line item that appears in the
    Business Processes list.
  5. In the
    Documents list, locate the step "IC Purchase Order (POIC)".
  6. Click on the document number link to display the intercompany purchase order.

Expected Result: The system displays the intercompany purchase order created in the selling company (1010) with the delivering plant (1710) as the vendor. Note down the

Purchase Order Number.

Step 3: Display Intercompany Sales Order

Objective: To confirm the creation of the corresponding intercompany sales order in the delivering company.

  • Role: Internal Sales Representative
  • App: Monitor Value Chains (F4854)

Execution Steps:

  1. Return to the Monitor Value Chains screen for your sales order.
  2. In the
    Documents list, locate the step "IC Sales Order (SOIC)".
  3. Click on the document number link to display the intercompany sales order .

Expected Result: The system displays the intercompany sales order created in the delivering company (1710). The sold-to party will be the intercompany customer representing the selling company (e.g.,

10411010). Note down the

Intercompany Sales Order Number.

Step 4: Create Delivery (Delivering Company)

Objective: The delivering company now creates an outbound delivery to ship the goods directly to the end customer.

  • Role: Shipping Specialist
  • App: Create Outbound Deliveries - From Sales Orders (F0869A)

Execution Steps:

  1. Open the
    Create Outbound Deliveries - From Sales Orders app.
  2. Enter the following selection criteria and click
    Go :
    • Shipping Point: 1710
    • Order: Your original sales order number from Step 1.
  3. Select the sales order item from the list and click
    Create Deliveries .

Expected Result: An outbound delivery document is created successfully. Note down the

Delivery Number.

Step 5: Perform Picking

Objective: To pick the goods from the storage location in preparation for shipping.

  • Role: Shipping Specialist
  • App: Manage Outbound Deliveries (F0867A) or My Outbound Delivery Monitor (VL06O)

Execution Steps:

  1. Open the
    My Outbound Delivery Monitor (VL06O) app.
  2. Click on
    For Picking.
  3. Enter your Shipping Point (
    1710) and press Execute.
  4. Select your delivery document and choose
    Change Outbound Deliveries.
  5. Navigate to the
    Picking tab.
  6. Enter the delivery quantity (e.g.,
    10) in the Picked Qty field.
  7. Click
    Save.

Expected Result: The picking status of the delivery is updated to "Fully Picked". The delivery document is saved.

Step 6: Post Goods Issue (PGI)

Objective: To post the goods issue, which signifies that the goods have left the delivering plant. This transaction transfers the material into Valuated Stock in Transit.

  • Role: Shipping Specialist
  • App: My Outbound Delivery Monitor (VL06O)

Execution Steps:

  1. Open the
    My Outbound Delivery Monitor (VL06O) app.
  2. Click on
    For Goods Issue.
  3. Enter your Shipping Point (
    1710) and press Execute.
  4. Select your delivery document and click the
    Post Goods Issue button.
  5. Confirm the posting date in the dialog box and click
    Continue.

Expected Result: The goods issue is posted successfully. The inventory in plant 1710 is reduced. The ownership of the goods is transferred to the selling company (1010) and is now reflected as

Stock in Transit. The follow-on goods movements are scheduled based on the Transfer of Control dates.

Step 7: Confirm Transfer of Control (ToC) Dates

Objective: To confirm the dates when the control of goods transfers between affiliates (internal) and from the selling company to the customer (external). This is a critical step that triggers further financial postings.

  • Role: Shipping Specialist
  • App: Outbound Delivery Monitor or directly change the outbound delivery.

Execution Steps:

  1. Find and open your outbound delivery in change mode.
  2. From the top menu, navigate via:
    More > Goto > Header > Shipment.
  3. In the
    Internal Transfer of Control Dates section, update the Actual Date and Time to the current system date and time. This controls the posting from the delivering company's SIT to the selling company's SIT.
  4. In the
    External Transfer of Control Dates section, update the Actual Date and Time to the current system date and time. This controls the final goods issue from the selling company's SIT to the customer (representing the COGS posting).
  5. Click Save.

Expected Result: The Transfer of Control dates are confirmed. The system executes the following goods movements and financial postings in the background :

  • Post Goods Issue from SiT in delivering company: COGS is posted for the delivering company.
  • Post Goods Receipt to selling company: Inventory is received into the selling company's books.
  • Post Stock Transfer to SiT in selling company: Inventory is moved to the selling company's SIT.
  • Post Goods Issue from SiT to Customer: COGS is posted for the selling company.

Step 8: Create Intercompany Invoice

Objective: The delivering company (1710) bills the selling company (1010) for the goods provided.

  • Role: Billing Clerk
  • App: Create Billing Documents (F0798)

Execution Steps:

  1. Open the
    Create Billing Documents app.
  2. In the search area, enter your
    Delivery Number and press Enter.
  3. Select the row for your delivery and click the
    Create Billing Documents button.
  4. A dialog box appears. Choose the following and click
    OK:
    • Billing Type: IV2 (Intercompany Invoice)
    • Billing Date: Current date
  5. The system will display a draft billing document. Review it and click
    Save.

Expected Result: An intercompany invoice (type IV2) is created and posted in company 1710. The system automatically triggers the creation of the corresponding intercompany supplier invoice in company 1010. Note down the

Intercompany Invoice Number.

Step 9: Display Intercompany Supplier Invoice

Objective: To confirm that the supplier invoice was automatically received and created in the selling company's system.

  • Role: Accounts Payable Accountant
  • App: Monitor Value Chains (F4854) or Supplier Invoices List (F1060a)

Execution Steps:

  1. Navigate back to the Monitor Value Chains app and refresh the view for your sales order.
  2. Locate the document for the step
    "IC Supplier Invoice (SIIC)" and click the link to display it.
  3. Alternatively, open the
    Supplier Invoices List app and search for the document using the intercompany invoice number in the Reference field.

Expected Result: The intercompany supplier invoice is displayed in the selling company's system. The vendor will be the intercompany supplier representing the delivering company (e.g.,

17401710).

Step 10: Create Customer Invoice

Objective: The final step is for the selling company (1010) to create the invoice for the end customer.

  • Role: Billing Clerk
  • App: Create Billing Documents (F0798)

Execution Steps:

  1. Open the
    Create Billing Documents app.
  2. Enter your
    Delivery Number in the search area and press Enter.
  3. Select the row for your delivery and click the
    Create Billing Documents button.
  4. In the dialog box, choose the following and click
    OK:
    • Billing Type: F2 (Invoice)
    • Billing Date: Current date
  5. Review the draft invoice and click
    Save.

Expected Result: The final customer invoice (type F2) is created and posted. The accounts receivable and revenue accounts are updated in the selling company's books. Note down the Customer Invoice Number.

Step 11: Monitor the Completed Value Chain

Objective: To review the entire end-to-end process flow and see the status of all linked documents in one place.

  • Role: Internal Sales Representative
  • App: Monitor Value Chains (F4854)

Execution Steps:

  1. Open the
    Monitor Value Chains app.
  2. Search for your initiating
    Sales Order Number.
  3. The system will display the value chain. All steps should now show a
    Completed status.
  4. Click on the
    Process Flow tab to see a graphical representation of the document flow. Each node in the flow chart represents a step and contains details like the document number and status .

Expected Result: The value chain monitor displays a complete, end-to-end flow chart of the process, with all documents linked and showing a completed (green) status. This provides a perfect audit trail of the entire transaction.

6. Summary

This guide has walked you through the Advanced Intercompany Sales process in SAP S/4HANA, from the initial customer order to the final invoicing and monitoring. By leveraging this functionality, organizations can manage complex internal supply chains with greater efficiency, transparency, and financial control. Following the business case and test plan provides a solid, practical understanding of how to execute and manage these transactions in a modern SAP environment.

entry.title: Re: Purchase order Percentage Price Condition on Purchase...
entry.content: Hi @Phil_P, When you post percentage based custom conditions through the SOAP API_SAP_COM_0238, the API schema enforces that you send a ConditionQuantitiy and unitCode, even though logically they are not required for percentage conditions. The correct way is for you to: • Pass the % in <ConditionRateValue> • Keep the <ConditionQuantity> as 1 with a neutral UoM such as the item’s base UoM • Ensure your condition type is configured in pricing with Calculation Type=A (Percentage) As mentioned earlier, this will create a 10% condition. Using % as unitCode is not supported, which explains why your system shows 0.00. Best regards Chris

entry.title: Replicating IT0006 to SAP ECP with a fixed address value, excluding address information in SF EC
entry.content:
Requirement:  A customer has requested that employee address data be replicated to SAP ECP using a fixed value for all employees. This is because SAP ECP does not require valid individual addresses. IT0006 is only used for payroll processing, and the customer does not utilize address data in IT0006 for any other business purpose.

To fulfill the above requirement, we configured Point-to-Point (PTP) replication as follows:

We removed the address_information query segment from the Compound Employee API Query Configuration under the Point-to-Point Replication settings in the SPRO node (as shown below). This effectively disables the retrieval of address data from SuccessFactors Employee Central during replication.

To enable replication of IT0006, we added it to the Infotype Filter configuration, thereby ensuring it is included in the scope of Point-to-Point replication processing.

Next, we need to populate fixed address data for IT0006.
To achieve this, we implement the BAdI HRSFEC_B_CE_PROCESS_ET under the Business Add-Ins for Point-to-Point Replication, as shown below. This enhancement allows us to inject constant address values during the replication process, bypassing address data from SuccessFactors Employee Central.

Below is a sample code snippet demonstrating the approach:

* Declarations
DATA: lt_pnnnn        TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF p0006 WITH DEFAULT KEY,
      lt_node_names   TYPE if_hrsfec_ce_purge_details=>tt_node_name,
      lv_employment_id TYPE hrsfec_employment_id,
      lt_p0006        TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF p0006 WITH DEFAULT KEY,
      wa_p0006        TYPE p0006.

* Register processed node for message handling
CALL METHOD io_message_handler->register_processed_node
  EXPORTING iv_processed_node = cl_hrsfec_service_lib=>gc_node_workagreement_item.

* Convert employment ID
lv_employment_id = is_employment_information-employment_id.

* Append relevant CE API segment
APPEND if_hrsfec_api_ce_data=>gc_segment-job_information TO lt_node_names.

* Check for data purge
IF io_hrsfec_ce_purge_details->is_purge_date_after_ftsd(
     iv_personnel_number = iv_personnel_number
     iv_employment_id    = lv_employment_id
     it_node_name        = lt_node_names
     iv_infty            = gc_infotype-infty_nnnn
     iv_badi_name        = 'HRSFEC_B_CE_PROCESS_ET' ) EQ abap_true.

  RETURN. "Abort processing to avoid unintended deletions

ENDIF.

* Populate fixed address data
  wa_p0006-pernr = iv_personnel_number.
  wa_p0006-begda = is_employment_information-start_date.
  wa_p0006-endda = '99991231'.
  wa_p0006-infty = '0006'.
  wa_p0006-subty = '1'.
  wa_p0006-anssa = '1'.
  wa_p0006-ort01 = 'City'.
  wa_p0006-itbld = '24'.
  wa_p0006-land1 = 'SA'.

  APPEND wa_p0006 TO lt_p0006.

* Update infotype framework
CALL METHOD cl_hrsfec_service_lib=>update_mass_pnnnn_data
  EXPORTING
    iv_pernr                  = iv_personnel_number
    iv_infty                  = '0006'
    io_message_handler        = io_message_handler
    io_masterdata_bl          = io_hrpa_masterdata_bl
    it_pnnnn                  = lt_p0006
    iv_full_trans_start_date = iv_full_transmission_start_dat.

entry.title: Re: Real world functional testing for courses in Success...
entry.content:
If this is happening for all users, I would test the lesson in SCORMCloud, there you can see all the logs and trace where the issue is occurring. This is one of our requirements that our designers successfully test in SCORMCloud before having the lessons uploaded to the LMS.

If this is not happening to ALL users, then I would look at individual browser settings. SF requires third-party cookies to be ON. Whereas all modern browsers have them OFF by default. If they are not on, users are booted out of the system after 30 minutes, regardless of if they are in the middle of a lesson or not. This has been our number 1 support ticket with our users for years....

For  testing, we usually make a checklist and/or testing script that the LMS team goes through. The check lists are for things like,

  • due date
  • title
  • is downloadable (we have a lot of users in the app)
  • is mobile enabled
  • marks complete
  • is reviewable
  • etc.

We use testing scripts with course owners when we have a complicated lesson or assessment with branching or question pools to try to ensure all the pathways through the lesson are tested. Otherwise course owners are more responsible for reviewing the content and interaction functionality. The Learning team (learning designers and  LMS admins) are the ones who make sure the course it talking to the LMS correctly.

Community discussion forums and study groups where people share preparation experiences

SkillCertExams, which some candidates mention for practice sets

If anyone has used these (or other reliable resources) and can share their experience, I’d really appreciate it. My main goal is to get practice questions that help me understand the exam style, not just memorize answers.

entry.title: Re: PO header and item text do not appear in printed form...
entry.content:
ok, so I got the help of our developer and it turns out that in the printing program, it was hard coded that any language outside of FR, DE, EN is to be considered EN! so we changed all the suppliers to EN and it worked.

not ideal but at least we see the text.
